cs4620.ray1

Class Ray

  • java.lang.Object
    • cs4620.ray1.Ray

  • public class Ray
extends java.lang.Object
    A ray is simply an origin point and a direction vector.
    Author:
    ags

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      Vector3d direction
      The normalized direction in which the ray travels.
      double end
      Ending t value of the ray
      static double EPSILON
      This quantity represents a "small amount" to handle comparisons in floating point computations.
      Vector3d origin
      The starting point of the ray.
      double start
      Starting t value of the ray

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Ray()
      Default constructor generates a trivial ray.
      Ray(Ray r) 
      Ray(Vector3d newOrigin, Vector3d newDirection)
      The explicit constructor.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void evaluate(Vector3d outPoint, double t)
      Sets outPoint to the point on this ray t units from the origin.
      void makeOffsetRay()
      Moves the origin of the ray EPISILON units along ray.
      void makeOffsetSegment(double newEnd)
      Offsets the ray origin by EPSILON and sets the end point of the ray to t.
      void set(Vector3d newOrigin, Vector3d newDirection)
      Sets this ray with the given direction and origin.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • EPSILON

        public static final double EPSILON
        This quantity represents a "small amount" to handle comparisons in floating point computations. It is often useful to have one global value across the ray tracer that stands for a "small amount".
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • origin

        public final Vector3d origin
        The starting point of the ray.

      • direction

        public final Vector3d direction
        The normalized direction in which the ray travels.

      • start

        public double start
        Starting t value of the ray

      • end

        public double end
        Ending t value of the ray

    • Constructor Detail

      • Ray

        public Ray()
        Default constructor generates a trivial ray.

      • Ray

        public Ray(Vector3d newOrigin,
   Vector3d newDirection)
        The explicit constructor. Values should be set here, and any variables that need to be calculated should be done here.
        Parameters:
        newOrigin - The origin of the new ray.
        newDirection - The direction of the new ray.

      • Ray

        public Ray(Ray r)

    • Method Detail

      • set

        public void set(Vector3d newOrigin,
       Vector3d newDirection)
        Sets this ray with the given direction and origin.
        Parameters:
        newOrigin - the new origin point
        newDirection - the new direction vector

      • evaluate

        public void evaluate(Vector3d outPoint,
            double t)
        Sets outPoint to the point on this ray t units from the origin. Note that t can be considered as distance along this ray only if the ray direction is normalized.
        Parameters:
        outPoint - the output point
        t - The distance along the ray.

      • makeOffsetRay

        public void makeOffsetRay()
        Moves the origin of the ray EPISILON units along ray. Avoids self intersection when casting rays from surfaces.

      • makeOffsetSegment

        public void makeOffsetSegment(double newEnd)
        Offsets the ray origin by EPSILON and sets the end point of the ray to t.
        Parameters:
        newEnd - the endpoint of the ray.
